metadata.name: PUA - Netcat Suspicious Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\nc.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\ncat.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netcat.exe')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -lvp ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -lvnp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -l -v -p ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -lv -p ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -l --proxy-type http ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -vnl --exec ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -vnl -e ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --lua-exec ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --sh-exec '))))

output.summary: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate ncat use References: https://nmap.org/ncat/, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1095/T1095.md, https://www.revshells.com/
